we have

Christmas

Brenda,
Nice to meet ya! I've heard of those magazines and I do believe my
library carries them. That always saves money but of course you
either have to photocopy stuff or make do without. I'll see if I can
try a copy at the library.
Tina

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] scienceathome magazine
messages.msgSnippet: ... I have no idea how expensive this magazine is, since I have never seen it. However, we ve enjoyed Click, and now it s older brother, Ask, both from Cricket
messages.messageBody:
> We subbed to it for a year. It was expensive so we didn't renew (six issues
> /year) but I thought it was great fun!

I have no idea how expensive this magazine is, since I have never seen it.
However, we've enjoyed Click, and now it's older brother, Ask, both from
Cricket Magazine Group. They're among my son's favorite magazines,
evidenced by the ever-growing pile of them he can't possibly give up. All
of Cricket Mag. Group's magazines run about $35/year, I think, but we have
the grandparents handling the subscription, and they renew it for Christmas
each year.

brenda

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: scienceathome magazine
messages.msgSnippet: Elissa, Was the money worth the magazine?  Do you happen to have an old address laying around? thanks Tina Hi TIna, I would say to #1, not here. (If the kids
messages.messageBody:
Elissa,
Was the money worth the magazine? Do you happen to have an old
address laying around?
thanks
Tina


Hi TIna,
I would say to #1, not here. (If the kids had requested to renew then I
would say Yes. I thought it was very cool but I love "science".
I don't have an address since we just moved and brought nothing extra to our
1 1/2 bedroom apartment!
I bet if you google it, you'll find one!
~Elissa Cleaveland
"It is nothing short of a miracle that the modern methods of instruction
have
not yet entirely strangled the holy curiosity of inquiry." A. Einstein

messages.subject: re: scienceathome magazine
messages.msgSnippet: Hi! It s the new kid again!  I was wondering if any of you subscribe to scienceathome magazine.  It was previewed and reccommended in HEM. The available
messages.messageBody:
Hi! It's the new kid again! I was wondering if any of you subscribe
to scienceathome magazine. It was previewed and reccommended in HEM.
The available website given in the issue doesn't work.
www.scienceathome.com
Do you know anything about it? Address? Is it worth it?
Thanks,
Tina
